revised_title: The Algorithmic Description of Natural Language and its Implications for Linguistic Theories
tldr: The author discusses the concept of algorithms and their application in the study of natural human language. They explore the idea of treating human utterances as programs that can be interpreted by the listener, and how this concept can be used to develop conversational programs and improve our understanding of language. The author also highlights the importance of using algorithmic descriptions in linguistic theories and their potential implications for neurophysiology and cognitive science.
